tweets.text: Tatenhill Brook burst its banks üåäüí¶earlier this year causing disruption on the @HighwaysEngland A38 which was closed for two days due to #flooding. We are working closely with @EnvAgencyMids on finding a solution to minimise the impact of future #flood events. #LetNatureHelp https://t.co/c3qKzlP1dU

tweets.text:
New @ForestryComm & @EnvAgency #Research & #Analysis on 3D-buffer strips 
https://t.co/9E4jYneVeQ
Good resource. Nothing particularly new. 
Q is - how do we ensure this info is in the hands of staff & contractors on the ground and gets put into practice? 
Via @Hydro_Mark @TM_WRT https://t.co/KFqU81rjiW

Heavy showers are expected across the North West this weekend and could lead to flooding in some communities. Check your flood risk and sign up for free flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn https://t.co/wS33bSNUZh

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text: @fran_gibbons @EnvAgency This is terrible üò•

It sounds too disgusting to be true... but I'm afraid it's not.  More raw sewage is being poured into Cotswold rivers by Thames Water. Wildlife dies. @EnvAgency lets it happen. Thames Water makes ¬£¬£¬£. Real life is more disgusting than fiction...! https://t.co/JlG3Q67ZPp
@rpud1961 Hi Raymond. This is in Billington, Lancashire.
Never seen a nutrient problem quite like this. Three sewage works and one village on septic tanks feeding one small stream. The #Wensum dying from the top down. https://t.co/cxV04qKrMm

NEW: Soil pollution is damaging Herefordshire's rivers and hitting fish species. 
Officers from @EnvAgencyMids are inspecting hundreds of recently harvested fields at risk from heavy rain, reminding farmers what steps they can take. Enforcement action could follow.@DaveThroupEA https://t.co/N5H3UQiaBQ

Do you feel that writing a letter exposing multi-billion corruption to either #Cabinet_Minister or #Prime_Minister_of_India have any impact? I feel no unless there is some political motive nobody heeds you irrespective of your post https://t.co/8BB9Wh6RqE  https://t.co/pIljz7NUFi

Did you hear our Area Flood and Coastal Risk Manager for #Cumbria @stewart_mounsey highlighting the simple steps you can take to prepare for potential #flooding on @BBC_Cumbria this morning? 

If you missed it you can catch up here ‚¨áÔ∏è

https://t.co/aEFr1RWHVU https://t.co/Q4TIhfe6RZ

#LondonRiversWeek is nearly over for 2020...

...but here's Neil, from our team of experts, in SW London...

Knows a thing or two about rivers... 

He's got some advice on how to stop river #pollution from homes and businesses... Anywhere...
#LRW2020 @RBKingston https://t.co/gqNrbLQXE5

Our waste team worked with various partners including @FenlandCouncil and @NorthantsPolice during @BTP week of Action.

We found two sites non-compliant with their permits so are investigating further. #Fenland #Crime https://t.co/7kflvw1Kam

New evidence of using phosphorus munitions with clear chemical elements by #Azerbaijani military in #Artsakh/#Karabakh - against forests & most importantly civilians -  civilians are hiding in forests during these days, causing mass destructions #DontBeBlind #terrorism #WarCrimes https://t.co/1K2zW3arWi

Heavy and persistent #rainfall could cause flooding in some parts of northern England and the Midlands from this evening into early next week.

Be prepared and sign up for #flood warnings: https://t.co/cFkNW3Vxu6 https://t.co/21jUeoXb2v

tweets.text: Just picked up @EnvAgencyNW duty manager for #Cumbria and #Lancashire - overall looking less wet than originally expected.  Our teams will be out clearing the screens and grids of those autumn leaves to keep the rivers flowing.  Others are tracking the rain and river levels. https://t.co/syk9MdwGNv

Our teams are out in Yorkshire checking temporary flood defences ahead of heavy rainfall tomorrow (images show Batley and Copley). Keep an eye on your local flood risk and be prepared to take action if you are at risk https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb #PrepareActSurvive #floodaware https://t.co/yP2gPSpvWj

Heavy rain is expected in Yorkshire over the weekend. Our teams are working hard to check our flood defences. 

Pictured are flood defences they have strengthened in Todmorden #Calderdale. #PrepareActSurvive 
https://t.co/HNBU0rgQzk https://t.co/PYpv46pwBX
Flood alert for lower River Ribble and River Darwen remains in force: https://t.co/c88YCQhvun @EnvAgencyNW
‚ö†Ô∏è Some communities across Dorset and Wiltshire are vulnerable to the impacts of groundwater flooding. Now is the time to https://t.co/G0SjP0XBX4 #groundwater ‚ö†Ô∏è https://t.co/5RMSAJeokG

If you've not caught it already, give your ears and minds a treat with a #LondonRiversWeek2020 @ThamesEstPart podcast special with me and lovely colleagues from @Thames21 @EnvAgency @SE_Rivers_Trust thanks to our talented Estuary Edges officer @eveasanders üåäüíôüëá https://t.co/B9bWxPUe47
